See also: salat, sälät, sālāt, and Sâlat

German[edit]

Etymology 1[edit]

From Middle High German salāt, from earlier Italian salata, a variant of insalata.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /zaˈlaːt/
  • audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -aːt

Noun[edit]

Salat m (genitive Salats or Salates, plural Salate, diminutive Salätchen n)

  1. salad (mixed, usually cold dish)
  2. lettuce and related leaf vegetables
Declension[edit]
Declension of Salat
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinderSalatdieSalate
genitiveeinesdesSalates,
Salats		derSalate
dativeeinemdemSalat,
Salate1		denSalaten
accusativeeinendenSalatdieSalate
1Now uncommon, see notes
Synonyms[edit]
  • (lettuce): Lattich

Etymology 2[edit]

From Arabic صَلَاة‎ (ṣalāh).

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Salah

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /saˈlaːt/

Noun[edit]

Salat f or n (genitive Salat or Salats, plural Salats or Salawat)

  1. (religion, Islam) obligatory prayer; salat
Synonyms[edit]
  • (islamisches) Pflichtgebet (commoner)
